summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons internal memorandum and inmate profile regarding inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, who was the cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It documents an interview with Tartaglione about a late-night incident where he awoke to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, prompting him to call for staff. The document also provides Tartaglione's disciplinary record and housing status.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Pre-trial inmate at MCC New York, cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein. He reported an incident where he awoke to find Epstein sitting and staring at him in their cell late at night.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell at MCC New York. Tartaglione reported a strange incident involving Epstein.

events.title: Interview regarding cell incident
events.description: An interview was conducted with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione regarding an incident with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein. Tartaglione reported waking up after midnight to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, leading Tartaglione to bang on the cell door and call for staff.

events.title: Tartaglione disciplinary incident: Fighting
events.description: Inmate Nicholas Tartaglione was sanctioned for fighting with another person.

events.title: Tartaglione pending report for possessing a hazardous tool
events.description: A pending disciplinary report for inmate Tartaglione for possessing a hazardous tool (referred to as a cell phone in the main memo).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
Cell Z06-215UAD (Housing Z, Range 06, Bed 215U AD)
keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione was the cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
Tartaglione reported an incident where he awoke after midnight to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, which prompted Tartaglione to call for staff assistance.
Tartaglione was a pre-trial inmate facing charges of murder and drug conspiracy, and was a former law enforcement officer.
Both Tartaglione and Epstein were housed in the Special Housing Unit at the time; Tartaglione for possession of a cell phone.
The document is dated July 23, 2019, which is prior to Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
